definition: lit. to go to war without just cause (idiom)/to act without justification

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: But supervisors are stopping short of slamming on the brakes.
sentences.chinese: 但是監管者此舉師出無名。

sentences.english: Due to the lack of legitimacy, the justice of the war is prevalently challenged.
sentences.chinese: 由於師出無名，這場戰爭始終存在着合法性危機。
